pull.title: [WIP] contrib: Remove distribution packaging
pull.body:
This has been moved to a separate repository, https://github.com/bitcoin-core/packaging

TODO need to find a distribution agnostic place, (somewhere under `share`?) for:
- [ ] `assets-attribution` (../contrib/debian/copyright)
- [ ] example configuration file `contrib/debian/examples/bitcoin.conf`

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

events.body:
Just did a quick search for `contrib/debian`, and it's still referenced and these files:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/assets-attribution.md
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/init.md
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

These should probably be updated here as well. Also, https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/Makefile.am contains a reference to `contrib/rpm`, not sure if that's a problem
@flack thanks, yes, those should be updated as well
I think it is much better to maintain this in the same repo, especially since the debian/ dir has things useful in general.

According to @thebluematt it's out of date half of the time anyway. If it's not kept in sync with releases there's no reason to keep it in the main repository.

> especially since the debian/ dir has things useful in general.

In that case, we should make sure it's moved somewhere else. 

I agree that we've salvaged generally useful parts from there before (though at least the man-pages had license issues preventing that), but for something that is useful in general, a distribution-packaging specific directory is not the place.
(I've repeatedly commented this about the desktop file, also that it should be installed with `make install`)

events.message:
contrib: Remove distribution packaging

This has been moved to a separate repository,
https://github.com/bitcoin-core/packaging

events.body:
Re "assets-attribution":

We are only talking about qt stuff in `./src/qt/res` and `share/pixmaps/`, so I think it is fine to just amend the Readme in those folders to include the copyright notices. (This way we don't have to do it a third time, when the gui is moved out of this repo)
